remarks.para: Application settings properties have a scope that is based either at the application or the user level. As the categories imply, application-scoped settings properties present uniform values to all users of the application, whereas user-scoped properties have dedicated values for each user of the application.
The indicates that a property should be considered an application-level setting, and that appropriate storage decisions should be made accordingly by the settings provider.

A scope attribute is required for each settings property. If a property is not applied with either a or , the property is not recognized by the settings providerâ€”it is not serialized. It is invalid, however, to apply both attributes to the same property. Such an attempt will cause a to be thrown.
